body:
-1 on monkey-patching `#join` but +1 on monkey-patching a new method.  There are certainly dragons involved to be sure, but from a readability standpoint it's hard to argue that:

    my_array.safe_join

looks a heckuva lot better than:

    ActiveSupport::SafeArray.new(my_array).join

Considering how much I personally need this, I'd hate to have to do option number 2 everywhere I needed it in my code.  Even if `#join` was a public class method, it would help, but not by much.

In the interest of "Just Work"ing I have to admit I like the idea of an additional method.  If ActiveSupport didn't monkey-patch core objects _at all_ then there would be a stronger case for not doing it here.

Just saw this PR and thought I'd add my 2 cents for what it's worth. :)  Thanks for looking into this!
